skillTree.localised_description: Covered in the Runelord’s ancient script, the anvil has given form to the most powerful runic weapons ever forged.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕Enemy casters within range suffer minor miscast explosion when casting

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer a leadership penalty when the Lord dies. It can also rally after routing more often.

skillTree.localised_description: There are none more adept at metal-shaping than those who command the runes.
All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Invoking the Rune of Hearth & Home stirs a Dwarf's pride in his Hold, Clan and Ancestors.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Dawi Rune Magic is potent, and damned hard to defend against!
A Runesmith may 'strike the runes' - a metaphor for refusing to let them cool, which reduces their potency.

effects.description: Shared cooldown: -10% for all Rune Magic

skillTree.localised_description: Grungni is the Ancestor God of Mining and Stoneworking, and is considered the principal deity of the Dwarf ancestor gods.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

Upkeep: -10% for Miners, Ironbreakers, Dwarf Engineers and Irondrakes units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +100% for Dwarf Miners and Ironbreakers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Valaya is the Ancestor Goddess of Home and Healing, wife of Grungni and Grimnir.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Grimnir is the Ancestor God of Warriors, and slayers in particular.
Gazul is the Ancestor God of Underearth and the Dwarf protector of the dead. Gazul's cult seeks out and purges the undead wherever its taint is found.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Vampire Counts
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -10% for Great Axe and Hammerer Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Smednir is the Ancestor God of of metalworking and ore refinement, creator of many great magical rune weapons including Ghal Maraz.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

Enemy spell resistance: -10%
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Thungni is the Ancestor God of Runesmithing, and brought the secrets of Runic magic to the Dwarf race.

skillTree.localised_description: Morgrim is the Ancestor God of Engineers, developing the first bolt and stone throwers of the Dwarves.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord and his az are never separated, for it is as much part of him as his beard.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Dwarf spent time in the pits, gaining a Miner's intuition of the dangers and prey to be found in the dark.

skillTree.localised_description: A Dwarf with a fine beard is as Dawi as they come.
Lords close to the powerful Masons' Guild will get discounts for labour and materials.

skillTree.localised_description: Such a Dawi does not care for being wounded - by his will alone he continues to fight.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

skillTree.localised_description: "All Dwarfs to me! We have grudges to settle - Grimnir demands it!"
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: A wise Lord will gather Engineers to his service, ensuring the Dwarfs maintain their technological edge.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit does not suffer a leadership penalty when the Lord dies. It can also rally after routing more often.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This brave Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grimnir, the Warrior-God.
This industrious Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grungni, God of Mines and Smiths.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This loyal Dawi can trace his lineage back to Valaya, Goddess of Healing and Protection.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)
